summary:
German is a widely spoken West Germanic language, primarily in Western and Central Europe. It's an official language in several countries like Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. With over 100 million native speakers, it's the second most spoken Germanic language after English. German is also taught worldwide and is significant in fields like science and technology.

The language has developed from Old High German and is closely related to Dutch, English, and Afrikaans. It's inflected, with complex grammar, and has multiple dialects. German-speaking communities exist globally, with notable populations in Brazil, South Africa, and Namibia.
title: German language
